document_notes.text:
This update for postgresql12 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-3677: Fixed memory disclosure in certain queries (bsc#1189748).

- Fixed build with llvm12 on s390x (bsc#1185952).
- Re-enabled icu for PostgreSQL 10 (bsc#1179945).
- Made the dependency of postgresqlXX-server-devel on llvm and clang optional (bsc#1187751).
- llvm12 breaks PostgreSQL 11 and 12 on s390x. Use llvm11 as a workaround (bsc#1185952).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in postgresql. A purpose-crafted query can read arbitrary bytes of server memory. In the default configuration, any authenticated database user can complete this attack at will. The attack does not require the ability to create objects. If server settings include max_worker_processes=0, the known versions of this attack are infeasible. However, undiscovered variants of the attack may be independent of that setting.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
